abstract: Harvard University announces restrictions that will be applied to members of single-sex clubs on campus, which include being barred from holding leadership positions and from receiving official recommendations required for postgraduate fellowships and scholarships; some 30 percent of undergraduates at Harvard, both male and female, belong to such clubs.

headline.print_headline: Rules May Force Elite Harvard Clubs to Abandon Longtime All-Male Status
headline.main: Harvard Restrictions Could Reshape Exclusive Student Clubs

snippet: Members of single-gender clubs will be barred from campus leadership positions, and from receiving official recommendations for postgraduate fellowships.
lead_paragraph: Members of single-gender clubs will be barred from campus leadership positions, and from receiving official recommendations for postgraduate fellowships.
